other question to tunneled X folks: is it as simple as running ssh -X on the remote machine?
After yoy 'ssh -X' you can just run X apps. Note: use 'ssh -C -X' for speed.

UOn ubuntu, you can tick a box in the remote desktop prefs to make vnc work.
Log in to Ubuntu, then 'Preferences -> Remote Desktop'
After that, you can ssh or vnc in.

Yup, or you could portforward (ssh -L 5700:localhost:5700 remotehost; then 'vncviewver localhost' locally)
